              En Hua Hu
            
            
              
                
            
          
        
        
        
          
            I am an economist specializing in decision theory. Questions I am interested in: how do people process information? How do they choose between complex options? I investigate these through theoretical and experimental methods.
            Currently, I am a PhD Candidate at the University of Toronto under the supervision of Yoram Halevy and Colin Stewart. Previously, I completed a M.Sc in Economics and Philosophy at the LSE and a B.Sc in Economics, Mathematics and Philosophy at the University of Toronto.
